question_sentence: Which organ from a pig was transplanted into a human in a groundbreaking surgery first reported by USA TODAY this week?
Which college football team fired its coach Monday after he declined to get vaccinated against COVID-19 despite a state mandate?
A 900-year-old sword believed to be a relic from the Crusades was found by an amateur diver off the coast of which country?
Colin Powell died Monday of COVID-19-related complications. Which is not true about him?
choices: He was appointed by George W. Bush to become the first Black state secretary.
He was born in New York to Jamaican immigrants.
He endorsed Barack Obama for president in 2008.
He was not fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

question_sentence: Who could become the world’s first trillionaire, according to a prediction by investment firm Morgan Stanley?
A study published this week says Vikings arrived in the Americas when?
Aaron Rodgers riled up opposing fans in Chicago during a touchdown celebration by saying:
Which tech giant is reportedly planning a rebrand featuring a name change?
True or false: A judge in Los Angeles approved Kanye West’s request to change his name to Ye.
Royal Caribbean Cruises announced what it says is the “longest and most comprehensive” world cruise. It will span:
Boris Johnson hinted that he could back plans to cut the wait for booster jabs from six months to how long?
evidence: The Daily Mail said shifting boosters forward by a month would mean an additional nine million people would become eligible.

question_sentence: Which European leader was accused of unleashing a wave of migrants on the EU’s eastern border?
evidence: The move prompted German Interior Minister Horst Seehofer to accuse Lukashenko of ‘state-sponsored human trafficking’.

question_sentence: The UK government opened negotiations to sell military arms to which country for the first time?
evidence: Talks were opened amid fears that Russia could exploit the gas crisis to seize territory held by Kiev.

question_sentence: Boris and Carrie Johnson got into hot water after it was revealed that they spent Christmas Day with which close friend?
evidence: The Daily Mirror reported that the couple may have broken lockdown rules when they spent Christmas Day with the social activist who is godmother to the couple’s son, Wilfred.

question_sentence: Which state clashed with the EU after a constitutional tribunal ruled that its constitution carries more weight than EU treaties?
evidence: Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki accused the bloc of using ‘the language of blackmail’ in the dispute over the rule of law.

question_sentence: In which city will the 26th United Nations Climate Change Conference of the Parties (Cop26) kick-off next week?
evidence: More than 25,000 people will descend on the city when it plays host to the 13-day summit.

question_sentence: Which country’s prime minister has vowed to abolish prostitution?
evidence: Pedro Sanchez promised to move forward with a ban telling supporters the practice ‘enslaves’ women.

question_sentence: Thousands gathered in Sudan’s capital Khartoum demanding a return to military rule to resolve the political turmoil that followed the 2019 overthrow of which dictator?
evidence: The protests come as ‘Sudanese politics reels from divisions among the factions steering the rocky transition from two decades of dictatorship’, The Guardian said.

question_sentence: ‘Small town mayor’ Peter Marki-Zay was selected to lead the unified opposition in a 2022 election in which European nation?
evidence: The conservative mayor has given rise to hope that strongman Viktor Orban could be ousted from power.

question_sentence: What is the name of the new social media network announced this week by Donald Trump?
evidence: The former president has said the social media network will ‘stand up to the tyranny of big tech’.

question_sentence: Countries are scrambling to place orders for a new antiviral called “molnupiravir”  that’s touted as an effective treatment for Covid-19. Which pharmaceutical company is manufacturing the drug?
evidence: If approved, Merck’s drug would be the first oral antiviral distributed as a treatment against Covid-19, with many viewing it as a pandemic game changer, particularly for countries still struggling with vaccine acquisition and distribution.

question_sentence: Which team won the WNBA championship, making it their first title win ever?
evidence: The Chicago Sky bested the Phoenix Mercury in Game 4 of the WNBA Finals, making it their first championship win ever.

question_sentence: Which singer set a Guinness World Record for being the oldest person to release an album of new material?
evidence: Tony Bennett set the record when he released “Love for Sale,” a collaboration with Lady Gaga on October 1. He was 95 years and 60 days old, according to Guinness.

question_sentence: What invasive animal herd in Colombia has grown to an unsustainable population of 80 – a direct result of drug kingpin Pablo Escobar bringing them into his private zoo in the 1980s?
evidence: Colloquially referred to as the “cocaine hippos,” authorities have implemented birth control measures to keep the 80-hippo bloat from growing even further as they pose an ever-increasing environmental and human safety risk.

question_sentence: Which tech giant is paying out $14 million to settle a case with the Justice Department alleging that US workers were discriminated against in favor of foreign visa holders in 2018 and 2019?
evidence: The lawsuit, filed in December 2020, alleges that Facebook concocted the scheme, including using recruitment methods to deter US workers from applying to certain positions and reserving jobs for temporary visa holders.

question_sentence: Which city’s mayor has ordered unvaccinated individuals 60 years and older to stay home for the next four months in response to the latest wave in Covid-19 cases?
evidence: In response to the city seeing the deadliest phase of the coronavirus pandemic to date, Moscow’s mayor made the order, including requiring those unvaccinated “suffering from chronic diseases” to stay home.

question_sentence: Colin Powell died this week due to complications of Covid-19. In which presidential administration did he serve as the country’s first Black secretary of state?
evidence: Powell served as secretary of state under George W. Bush, though he served in other administrations — including George H.W. Bush — in various distinguished positions and directed US foreign policies on dozens of fronts over his tenure, most notably following the September 11th terrorist attacks.

question_sentence: California Governor Gavin Newsom issued an executive order with the focus of bringing “innovative solutions to tackle immediate challenges.” What’s the focus of the executive order?
choices: to switch the state’s focus to renewable energy
to address a growing supply chain backlog
to overhaul resources at the southern border
evidence: Governor Gov. Gavin Newsom issued the executive order to address the growing logjam of goods coming into California’s ports, a problem instigated by the pandemic and affecting supply chains worldwide.

question_sentence: The United Kingdom and which other country have settled on a new trade pact, ultimately meant to reduce tariffs on bulldozers, wine, buses and clothing?
evidence: The deal was struck between the UK and New Zealand, one of the latest following the UK’s departure from the European Union.

question_sentence: A judge granted Kanye West’s request to change his name. What’s his new official name?
evidence: Following the approval from a California judge, Kanye West’s official name is now just “Ye.”
